summary: I PURCHASED A 2006 UNITED MOTORS DS200 IN SEPTEMBER 2006. TODAY THE HEADLIGHT AND TAIL LIGHT FAILED AS I RODE THE MOTORCYCLE. THE PROBLEM WAS IN THE LOW BEAM TO HIGH BEAM SWITCH.     THE INTERNALS OF THE SWITCH HAD ACTUALLY CRUMBLED APART CAUSING BOTH FRONT AND REAR LIGHTS TO FAIL. I WAS ABLE TO DO A ROADSIDE REPAIR TO GET THE LIGHTS WORKING ON GET HOME SAFELY. THE MOTORCYCLE HAS ONLY 1,434 MILES ON IT WHEN THE SWITCH FAILED (ALL THE BULBS WERE IN WORKING ORDER). I FEEL THAT HAVING THE LIGHTS GO OUT ON A MOTORCYCLE IS EXTREMELY DANGEROUS. BEING SEEN IS HARD ENOUGH WITH WORKING EQUIPMENT, NOT HAVING ANY LIGHTS CAN BE LETHAL. *TR
